title.rendered: 10 Best Adobe Premiere Courses to Take in 2023

content.rendered:
Whether you’re a professional videographer or a YouTube content creator, video editing is something you simply can’t ignore. Quality sets you apart, no matter what you’re creating. And speaking of quality, Adobe always brings to us the best industry-leading software, and Premiere is no exception.

In this guide, I’ve selected the 10 best free and paid Adobe Premiere online courses for you from the 250+ Adobe Premiere courses on our catalog by following a well-defined methodology that you can find below.

But if you want to jump straight to the results, here are my top 10 picks. You can click on a course to jump to the corresponding section:

Course Workload In Brief
1. Learn EVERYTHING about Premiere Pro (Jack Cole) 10 hours Best free online course to learn Adobe Premiere Pro with in-video practice exercises
2. Adobe Premiere Pro CC – Essentials Training Course (Udemy) 16 hours Great alternative course to learn Adobe Premiere Pro with an Adobe certified instructor
3. Advanced Premiere Pro for Everyone (Envato Tuts+) 3-4 hours Short, free Adobe Premiere Pro course for advanced learners from a popular instructor
4. Premiere Pro CC for Beginners: Video Editing in Premiere (Udemy) 25 hours Extensive course to learn Adobe Premiere Pro from basics to more advanced concepts
5. Advanced Video Editing with Adobe Premiere Pro 2020 (Skillshare) 3-4 hours Great alternative course for advanced learners to master Adobe Premiere Pro
6. Adobe Premiere Pro Complete Video Editing Masterclass 2020 (Udemy) 15 hours Practical, hands-on Adobe Premiere Pro course for beginners with free assets
7. Adobe Premiere Pro for Beginners (Domestika) 7-8 hours Affordable, six-part complete course for learning all about Adobe Premiere Pro
8. Premiere Pro 2022 Essential Training (LinkedIn Learning) 6 hours Interactive, project-based course to learn the essentials of Adobe Premiere Pro with free trial
9. Learn to Edit Video FAST! Adobe Premiere Pro 2022 StepByStep (Udemy) 4-5 hours Good course with free assets to learn how to edit videos in Adobe Premiere Pro fast
10. Getting Started with Premiere Pro for the Non-Video Pro (LinkedIn Learning) 3-4 hours Short course to get started with video editing in Adobe Premiere Pro with free trial

What is Adobe Premiere?

Adobe Premiere, better known as Adobe Premiere Pro, is an industry-leading video editing software that lets you create stunning videos fast. Whether from a professional camera or from your phone, you can edit all kinds of footage in Premiere Pro – upto 8K!

Premiere Pro has all the tools you need to import and edit, add effects and export footage. It also comes with professional templates and music tracks to make your storytelling unique. Premiere Pro also works with other apps and services, including Adobe Photoshop, After Effects and Frame.io. A 7-day free trial is available for Premiere Pro.

Versions of Adobe Premiere

The original version of Adobe Premiere was first launched in 1991, and its final version was released in 2002. A year later, in 2003, it was replaced by Adobe Premiere Pro, a rewritten version of Adobe Premiere. In short, Premiere Pro refers to versions released in 2003 and later, whereas Premiere refers to the earlier releases.

Adobe Premiere Pro Creative Cloud (CC) is the cloud-based version of Premiere Pro that works on monthly Creative Cloud plan subscription. It always gives you access to the latest versions of the software and even features collaborative cloud environments to work with a remote team.

Why are Adobe Premiere Skills Important?

The video editing market is well-established with plenty of professionals ready to tackle any project. According to Straits Research, the video editing market will reach $3.24 billion by 2030 and there definitely are opportunities even for newcomers!

At the moment, there are over 2,570 jobs posted for Adobe Premiere Specialist on Upwork and the average salary for this position is of USD 58K a year in the US according to Glassdoor.

What is My Experience with Adobe Premiere?

I am a Guided Project Instructor and a Beta Tester at Coursera, having tested many courses before they’re officially launched. I have taken over 50 online courses in various subjects.

My experience as an online learner and teacher has given me some perspective on what to look for in an online course. I used my experience to evaluate each course in this list.

Course Ranking Methodology

I built this ranking following the now tried-and-tested methodology I used in previous rankings (you can find them all here). It involves a three-step process:

  1. Research: I started by leveraging Class Central’s database with 100K online courses and 200K+ reviews. Then, I made a preliminary selection of 250+ Adobe Premiere courses by rating, reviews, and bookmarks.
  2. Evaluate: I read through reviews on Class Central, Reddit, and course providers to understand what other learners thought about each course and combined it with my own experience as a learner.
  3. Select: Well-made courses were picked if they presented valuable and engaging content and they have to fit in a set of criteria and be ranked accordingly: comprehensive curriculum, release date, affordability, ratings and enrollments.

The end result is a unique selection of courses that combines a decade of Class Central data and my own experience as an online learner to try to get the best of both worlds. So far, I’ve spent more than 10 hours building this list, and I’ll continue to update it.

Course Ranking Statistics

Here are some statistics regarding this course ranking:

  • Combined, these courses have accrued over 528.3K enrollments.
  • 2 courses are free or free-to-audit and 8 courses are paid.
  • The most-represented course provider in the ranking is Udemy, with 4 courses.
  • All 10 courses are in English.
  • The Adobe Premiere subject is followed by over 4.8K learners on Class Central, and accounts for over 250 courses in Class Central catalog.

So without further ado, let’s get to my picks for the best Adobe Premiere online courses.

1. Learn EVERYTHING about Premiere Pro (Jack Cole)

My first pick for the best Adobe Premiere online course is the free course, Learn EVERYTHING about Premiere Pro, offered by Jack Cole on YouTube.

Not too long, not too short, this course is fairly enough for a beginner in video editing to learn everything from the basics of Adobe Premiere Pro like tools and shortcuts to more advanced features such as creating custom transitions and green screens. In short, this is the best free course to learn Adobe Premiere Pro.

What You’ll Learn

First, you’ll learn about creating a new project. You’ll be introduced to the layout, learn how to import and organize media, create new sequences, use important tools and shortcuts, get workflow tips, apply motion breakdown and effect control breakdown, and add and adjust effects on a clip.

Next, you’ll explore warp stabilizer, solids and adjustments, edit to the beat, be introduced to essential graphics, create and customize basic titles, use the Adobe templates library, import and customize a premium template, create advanced titles and graphics, and add title transitions.

Then, you’ll learn how to animate a title sequence with transitions, be introduced to Lumetri color, understand basic color correction and basic color grading, use Adobe LUT presets, premium LUTS, adjustment layers and audio adjustments, and improve audio quality.

After that, you’ll remove background noise, reduce echo, explore audio transition, sound design, sound effect and premium audio presets, import a sequence with sound design, understand effect library breakdown, and adjust effects with keyframes.

You’ll also learn how to get the cinematic look, mask in Premiere Pro, perform dynamic link with After Effects, green screen work, basic video and audio transitions, transition overlays and advanced transition presets, create custom transitions, and export a screenshot and sections of a video.

Finally, you’ll take a look at the best export settings, export with transparent background, edit a video intro from scratch, edit a YouTube video from scratch, edit micro content from scratch, and edit a promo video from scratch.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 78 videos. Each video involves about 5 minutes of work. Concepts are taught through a combination of video lectures and in-video exercises. Downloadable resources are provided in the YouTube description of the course. Just click on Start Learning and go to Direct link.

Channel Jack Cole
Provider YouTube
Instructor Jack Cole
Level Beginner
Workload 10 hours
Certificate Not available

Fun Facts

  • Cole’s YouTube channel has over 430K subscribers.
  • He posts regularly about videography, free editing softwares tutorials, and tips on how to make money online with freelancing and content creation.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

2. Adobe Premiere Pro CC – Essentials Training Course (Udemy)

My second pick for the best Adobe Premiere online course is Adobe Premiere Pro CC – Essentials Training Course on Udemy.

Straight from an Adobe certified instructor, this course is the second-best on this list, and the reason is because it’s paid. But if you’re willing to shell out a little, this course might just be the perfect match for you. From interviews to weddings and documentaries to YouTube videos, you’ll be able to edit them all.

What You’ll Learn

In this course, you’ll learn how to edit a video interview, a wedding video, a short documentary, social media advertising videos for Instagram, Facebook, Twitter & Youtube Stories, YouTube ‘how to’ videos, and talking head footage mixed with screencasts and voiceovers.

You’ll understand the differences between After Effects and Premiere Pro, add import video to your Premiere Pro project, create color grading video using LUTs and Looks, create video transitions, add animated text and lower thirds, and export video for social media, Youtube and film.

Then, you’ll organize your video editing footage like a pro, find free music and video, get video effects like cinema effects, black and white, film grain, vignettes, orange and teal effect, speed up Premiere Pro, and work with transition and video effects presets and templates.

Next, you’ll master Lumetri color, remove echo, background noise like fans, aircon and fridge hum, loop background music, sync aligning video and audio automatically, animate using keyframes, master the essentials graphics panel, and work with HD and 4K videos.

Finally, you’ll understand frames per second (FPS), aspect ratios and codecs, create motion graphic, work with high frame rates, work with b-roll, zoom in and out with screen capture video and voice over audio, use green screen, change images into videos, and get Premiere Pro shortcuts.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 14 sections. Each section involves about 1 to 2 hours of work. Concepts are taught through a combination of videos and project assignments.

Provider Udemy
Instructor Daniel Scott
Level Beginner
Workload 16 hours
Enrollments 28.8K
Rating 4.7/5.0 (7.1K)
Certificate Paid

Additional Info

  • This course is a bestseller on Udemy and is also available on Skillshare.
  • This course also has a 2-hour free sample available on YouTube.
  • After finishing the essentials, you can take Scott’s next course, Adobe Premiere Pro CC – Advanced Training Course.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

3. Advanced Premiere Pro for Everyone (Envato Tuts+)

My third pick for the best Adobe Premiere online course is the free course, Advanced Premiere Pro for Everyone, offered by Envato Tuts+ on YouTube.

This is another awesome free course to learn Adobe Premiere Pro from one of the most popular tutorial channels on YouTube. This course is aimed towards advanced learners willing to take their video editing skills to the next level. Basically, this is the best Adobe Premiere Pro course for advanced learners.

What You’ll Learn

In the first module, you’ll learn about source patching and track targeting. You’ll understand track lock and sync lock, three-point and four-point edits, dynamic trimming, automate to sequence, slow motion, speed ramps, and scene edit detection.

In the second module, you’ll learn about raw footage. You’ll work with log footage and LUTs, use colorchecker cards, and use shot matching for color.

In the third module, you’ll take a look at how to fix audio drift. You’ll merge clips, use multiple compressors, master bus effects, and work on loudness normalization on export.

Finally, in the third module, you’ll learn how to use multiple monitors with Premiere. You’ll use third party video effects, understand MOGRTS, add post-production camera moves, and perform creative edits such as multi-box and music markers.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 26 videos. Each video involves about 5 to 10 minutes of work. Concepts are taught through a combination of video lectures only.

Channel Envato Tuts+
Provider YouTube
Instructor Dave Bode
Level Advanced
Workload 3-4 hours
Certificate Not available

Fun Facts

  • Envato Tuts+ has an older version of this tutorial from 2018 with Bode with over 1.2M views, and its sequel in 2020 addressing the frequently asked questions.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

4. Premiere Pro CC for Beginners: Video Editing in Premiere (Udemy)

My fourth pick for the best Adobe Premiere online course is Premiere Pro CC for Beginners: Video Editing in Premiere on Udemy.

Are you a beginner ready to become a pro at Adobe Premiere? Well, then you don’t want to miss out on this extensive course which will help you master your video editing skills in Adobe Premiere Pro CC and become confident in your video editing skills. Learn to edit an entire video from beginning to end such that they actually look good.

What You’ll Learn

In this course, you’ll learn how to edit an entire video from beginning to end. You’ll edit your promo video with the supplied footage or your own footage, start a project with the right settings for any type of video from any camera, and export and save your videos for 4K and HD playback.

You’ll also make your videos more dynamic with cutaway footage and photos, design clean and professional titles for your videos, add motion to your titles, photos and videos, and color correct your video to fix issues with white balance and exposure.

Finally, you’ll add feelings to your video with color grading, apply visual effects such as stabilizing shaky video, removing grain, and making video more cinematic with overlays, and edit green screen footage and add backgrounds.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 20 sections. Each section involves about 30 minutes to 1 hour of work. Concepts are taught through a combination of videos and readings.

Provider Udemy
Instructor Phil Ebiner
Level Beginner
Workload 25 hours
Enrollments 435K
Rating 4.7/5.0 (32.2K)
Certificate Paid

Fun Facts

  • This course is a bestseller on Udemy.
  • Ebiner is a top-rated Udemy instructor with 2.5M+ students.
  • Another course from Ebiner is featured on my Adobe Lightroom guide.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

5. Advanced Video Editing with Adobe Premiere Pro 2020 (Skillshare)

My fifth pick for the best Adobe Premiere online course is Advanced Video Editing with Adobe Premiere Pro 2020 on Skillshare.

This is another great course for advanced learners. In this complete Adobe Premiere Pro class, you’ll learn advanced editing techniques, 2D animations, audio enhancing and color corrections. You’ll learn Adobe Premiere Pro in such a way that you can focus on the creative side of editing by eliminating technical challenges.

What You’ll Learn

First, you’ll explore the basic editing workflow, sequence settings, advanced shortcuts, shortcut layouts, fit to frame size vs. scale to frame size, pancake editing workflow, multicamera editing, timeline customization, project settings, and multi language closed captions.

Next, you’ll take a look at advanced animations with keyframes, work with essential graphics, create custom presets, use advanced text graphics, create custom templates, track matte transitions, transform effect and motion blur, and stabilize footage.

After that, you’ll learn about advanced time remapping, masking techniques and mask tracking, match clips with color correction, create a look with color grading, perform dynamic linking to After Effects and Audition, fix audio issues.

Finally, you’ll add audio mixing music and dialogue, get sound design tips and tricks, synchronize audio and video, preview rendering, work with proxies, explore export options, and understand Premiere Pro versions and downgrade projects.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 34 lessons. Each lesson involves about 5 to 10 minutes of work. Concepts are taught through a combination of videos and projects. Downloadable resources are also provided.

Provider Skillshare
Instructor Jordy Vandeput
Level Advanced
Workload 3-4 hours
Enrollments 33.4K
Rating 100%
Certificate Not available

Fun Facts

  • Vandeput is a top teacher on Skillshare with 14 courses available mostly on videography and video editing.
  • Vandeput also has a beginners’ course on video editing, Video Editing with Adobe Premiere Pro for Beginners.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

6. Adobe Premiere Pro Complete Video Editing Masterclass 2020 (Udemy)

My sixth pick for the best Adobe Premiere online course is Adobe Premiere Pro Complete Video Editing Masterclass 2020 on Udemy.

Learn all the essential concepts of video editing as well as tips and shortcuts step by step with the help of activity exercises and hands-on practice. All assets such as video footage, music and templates are provided throughout the course. After taking this course, you’ll have a solid foundation of Adobe Premiere Pro.

What You’ll Learn

In this course, you’ll be introduced to Adobe Premiere Pro. You’ll learn how to set up a project, import media, organize media, get the basics and essentials of video editing, organize markers and clips, add video transitions, use advanced editing techniques, and add motion to clips.

You’ll also edit and enhance audio, add video effects, perform color correction and grading, use composition and green screen, create video slideshow, create new graphics, add titles, adjust video speed and time remapping, export video, and get many bonus tutorials.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 23 sections. Each section involves about 30 minutes to 1 hour of work. Concepts are taught through a combination of videos, readings and quizzes.

Provider Udemy
Instructor Paul Nene, Rose Nene
Level Beginner
Workload 15 hours
Enrollments 42.3K
Rating 4.8/5.0
Certificate Paid

Fun Facts

  • Paul and Rose are a couple and they started their journey in photography and videography after coming back from a trip in 2013.
  • In 2017 they launched their photography and videography business.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

7. Adobe Premiere Pro for Beginners (Domestika)

My seventh pick for the best Adobe Premiere online course is Adobe Premiere Pro for Beginners on Domestika.

This course consists of 6 subcourses:

  1. Editing, Timelines, and Sequences
  2. Using Effects on Your Footage
  3. Lumetri: Edit Color and Light
  4. Enhancing and Adding Audio
  5. Exporting and Best Practices

This course covers the Adobe Premiere Pro interface to tools for editing sound and everything in between. It is not expensive, and is worth a try if you want to learn all about this industry-leading software.

What You’ll Learn

First, you’ll understand and use video files, organize and structure your digital assets, create a new project and connect scratch disks, import your files and locate your files, get an overview of items in the top menus, and set up a project folder and create a new project.

Next, you’ll use the Premiere Pro windows: project window, source window, timeline and program window, use the canvas and viewer (source window and program monitor), work with the timeline: non-linear assembly, toolbar and shortcuts, use transitions, and create titles.

Then, you’ll work with the sequence: 3-point editing and pancake editing, be introduced to keyframes, time-remapping and masks, understand auto-reframe, essentials graphics panel, color correction and grading using Lumetri, HSL tool, effects panel, and work with sound and remove noises.

Finally, you’ll be introduced to sound design, work with amplification and compression, record audio within Premiere Pro, perform final check before exporting, work with the export panel, export your project and settings, and export multiple videos with media encoder.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 6 subcourses (40 lessons). Concepts are taught through a combination of videos, readings and exercises.

Provider Domestika
Instructor Alex Hall
Level Beginner
Workload 7-8 hours
Enrollments 4.3K
Rating 99%
Certificate Paid

Fun Facts

  • According to Hall, his passion for photography began with his broken phone in 2008 forcing him to see the world around.
  • In the 2011 Occupy Wall Street protests in New York, he was able to document what was happening as his first experience in video journalism.
  • Several months later, he bought his first camera and turned his hobby into his career.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

8. Premiere Pro 2022 Essential Training (LinkedIn Learning)

My eighth pick for the best Adobe Premiere online course is Premiere Pro 2022 Essential Training on LinkedIn Learning.

This course has an interactive project-based approach. You’ll learn all the essentials of Adobe Premiere Pro while building a short promo video from start to finish. This course will enable you to become comfortable in both the technical and creative sides of the editing process. A 1-month free trial is available.

What You’ll Learn

In the first module, you’ll get to know Adobe Premiere Pro. You’ll start a new project, open an existing project, tour the project panel, tour the source monitor, tour the timeline, and tour the interface and workspaces.

In the second module, you’ll set up and organize your media. You’ll organize your assets, use the import window and media browser, understand asset types, organize assets using bins, move, copy, and delete assets, and perform searches.

In the third module, you’ll learn basic editing. You’ll lay the foundation, play and marking shots, subclip shots, set up a sequence, perform insert edits to build the sequence, move clips and swapping shots, remove material for concision, and add video b-roll.

In the fourth module, you’ll refine the edit using trim tools. You’ll fine-tune the product, trim shot length using ripple trims, adjust transitions using roll trims, change content and position using slip and slide, and perform top and tail edits.

In the fifth module, you’ll explore additional edit and organizational techniques. You’ll use markers for organization, understand track and clip behavior, work with scene edit detection, undo and redo actions, customize the keyboard, and modify buttons on the user interface.

In the sixth module, you’ll learn basic audio editing. You’ll build the soundtrack, explore audio channel configuration, edit in your music, make audio gain adjustments, adjust audio volume, keyframe audio volume, and work with double-system sound.

In the seventh module, you’ll work with stills and graphics. You’ll find depth and meaning within photos, work with stills, and animate stills.

In the eighth module, you’ll work with effects. You’ll correct and change your footage, use basic motion effects, work with transition effects, apply and modify video effects, save and share effects, work with adjustment layers and nests, add effects to master clips, keyframe effects over time, and mask and tracking effects.

In the ninth module, you’ll manipulate clip speed. You’ll create freeze frames and stills, perform fit-to-fill editing, change clip speed with the rate stretch tool, and use the speed duration tool.

In the tenth module, you’ll perform basic color correction. You’ll fix and enhance color, analyze shots, read video scopes, use basic color correction tools, make color corrections using curves, and compare and match color corrections.

In the eleventh module, you’ll work with titles. You’ll use text to inform and elevate the project, create automatic transcripts and captions, create basic titles, and work in the essential graphics panel.

Finally, in the twelfth module, you’ll finish and export your project. You’ll learn about export and delivery, exporting your project, and batch exporting with Adobe Media Encoder.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 12 modules. Each module involves about 20 to 40 minutes of work. Concepts are taught through a combination of videos, quizzes and practice exercises.

Provider LinkedIn Learning
Instructor Ashley Kennedy
Level Beginner
Workload 6 hours
Enrollments 5.2K
Rating 4.8/5.0
Certificate Paid

Fun Facts

  • Kennedy is a managing staff instructor at LinkedIn Learning.
  • She leads a team of instructors in the Creative and Business libraries.
  • She also creates courses on video editing, filmmaking, and various business topics.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

9. Learn to Edit Video FAST! Adobe Premiere Pro 2022 StepByStep (Udemy)

My ninth pick for the best Adobe Premiere online course is Learn to Edit Video FAST! Adobe Premiere Pro 2022 on Udemy.

Aimed towards beginners, this course takes you step by step through the process of video editing using Adobe Premiere Pro so that you can edit fast. This course covers everything from the basics of Adobe Premiere Pro to more advanced concepts like green screen and color grading. Free video footage and music are available for download.

What You’ll Learn

In this course, you’ll cover the following topics:

  • Layout of Adobe Premiere Pro
  • What the tools are to edit with
  • How to edit fast
  • Import video, cutting, adding music, sound effects, transitions
  • More advanced features like green screen and noise reduction
  • Search for and apply for jobs as an editor, freelance work or with a company
  • Where to find these jobs and what you’ll need
  • Learn how to download Adobe Premiere Pro

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 43 lectures. Each lecture involves about 30 minutes to 1.5 hours of work. Concepts are taught through a combination of videos and readings.

Provider Udemy
Instructor Dan Britain
Level Beginner
Workload 4-5 hours
Enrollments 8.3K
Rating 4.7/5.0
Certificate Paid

Fun Facts

  • Britain is a YouTube consultant and creator with years of experience working in the TV and film industry as production crew, researcher and editor.
  • Since then, he went on to consult various companies and advise individuals on growing YouTube channels.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

10. Getting Started with Premiere Pro for the Non-Video Pro (LinkedIn Learning)

My tenth pick for the best Adobe Premiere online course is Getting Started with Premiere Pro for the Non-Video Pro on LinkedIn Learning.

With this course, beginners can easily get started with video editing in Adobe Premiere Pro without having any prior knowledge. With detailed step by step instructions, you’ll learn everything from organizing your media to finalizing your project, so that you can easily create your first project in Adobe Premiere Pro right away. A 1-month free trial is available.

What You’ll Learn

In the first module, you’ll learn how to approach video editing. You’ll understand the goal of video editing, work non-destructively, and configure your computer for best results.

In the second module, you’ll organize your media. You’ll choose a hard drive for editing, transfer your media to a drive, organize a project with the common media folder, browse and rename clips, and transfer a project from Rush to Premiere Pro.

In the third module, you’ll set up your project in Premiere Pro. You’ll create a new Premiere Pro project, import assets into Premiere Pro, organize footage with bins in Premiere Pro, sync clips, create a sequence in Premiere Pro, set your Premiere Pro project for autobackup, and create a project template in Premiere Pro.

In the fourth module, you’ll sequence clips to tell a story. You’ll search and find clips in Premiere Pro, mark in and out points in Premiere Pro, understand the role of subclips in Premiere Pro, and add clips to a Premiere Pro sequence.

In the fifth module, you’ll refine clips in a sequence, make top and tail edits in Premiere Pro, trim and extend clips in Premiere Pro, and add a transition to a clip in Premiere Pro.

In the sixth module, you’ll organize your sequence. You’ll understand the role of tracks in a Premiere Pro sequence, set up multiple audio tracks for audio mixing in Premiere Pro, add elements to a higher video track in Premiere Pro, change the order of shots in a Premiere Pro sequence, and lock the story.

In the seventh module, you’ll be introduced to color and image correction. You’ll see that every shot needs color correction and reusing adjustments on multiple clips, fix exposure in a video clip in Premiere Pro, refine color in a video clip in Premiere Pro, improve a shot’s aesthetics in Premiere Pro, and send a shot to After Effects with Dynamic Link.

In the eighth module, you’ll be introduced to audio. You’ll revisit track organization, get and introduction to the essential sound panel in Premiere Pro, normalize volume for several clips in Premiere Pro, mix music and sound effects with the essential sound panel, and get an introduction to manually adjusting audio.

In the ninth module, you’ll be introduced to graphics. You’ll get an introduction to the essential graphics panel in Premiere Pro, work with graphic templates in Premiere Pro, import graphics from Photoshop in Premiere Pro, and add open captions to your video in Premiere Pro.

Finally, in the tenth module, you’ll finalize your project. You’ll back up your Premiere Pro project files, back up your media in Premiere Pro, trim a Premiere Pro project for archive, export a video file from Premiere Pro, and take more control with Adobe Media Encoder.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into10 modules. Each module involves about 20 to 30 minutes of work. Concepts are taught through a combination of videos and practice exercises.

Provider LinkedIn Learning
Instructor Richard Harrington
Level Beginner
Workload 3-4 hours
Enrollments 5K
Rating 4.7/5.0
Certificate Paid

Fun Facts

  • Harrington is a digital video expert, educator, speaker and author.
  • He is the founder of the visual communications company, RHED Pixel, in Washington, DC.
  • He is also a certified instructor for Adobe and Apple and a member of the National Association of Photoshop Professionals Instructor Dream Team.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.
